answers.answer: What makes them say you are going to have a big baby? If your doctor would try to tell you to get a csection based on babys weight I would get a second opinion. They dont know what your body is capable of doing in labor and dont know the size of baby for sure.
Oh my gosh......an 11 lb baby. Thats a big baby. I hope my boy is not that big. I would be so scared.

Well I have gestational diabetes which they said women with that have big babies and the ultrasound measured him at 3lbs 8ozs at 29 weeks.  And from what I have read and heard from others that is big.

Who keeps telling you? I was almost 11 lbs my mom had me vaginally with no issues. Most babies if the come out around the due date will be 6-8 lbs if you go over your due date between 1-14 days which is the max they usually allow you'll be looking at a baby from 7-9 maybe 10 lbs but that's normal. My son was 10 days late they said he was a big baby but he came out at 8.8 lbs I pushed him out in 15 minutes.
I wouldnt worry girl. My mom had GD with me and I was under 7 lbs :)

Well the doctors could have the baby's weight off they aren't always correct. But yes youre about a lb over but that's not a big deal. If your baby is getting too big they may just induce on your due date.

I am more scared of a c-section more then anything. I dont want one and my doctor said with GD he will be over weight and if I try to push I will hurt him. I might also add that this lady is the meanest dr I have ever met.she told me to lose weight and I am 30 weeks and have only gained 15 lbs.

You have to try it natural either way..  I wanted natural with my first to but i didnt dialate enough and she was huge i had a 9lb 6 oz baby.. I was in labor for 30 hours then they told me i needed to have a c section
I would find a new one. I wish I would have when I didnt like my doctor but now I am almost 38 weeks.

Well-controlled gestational diabetes doesn't usually result in oversized babies - it's usually only if you aren't diagnosed quickly or you don't modify your diet or take the prescribed meds/insulin that babies tend to grow so much. My son came right on time, day after his due date, and he was nine pounds - an unmedicated vaginal birth - after everyone told me he'd be about 7 maybe 7.5 pounds. So it's always just a guess even with ultrasound measurements. Big babies can absolutely be born vaginally, I have a friend who had a 10lb11oz babe vaginally with no issues and she's a small-framed woman. Don't worry a bit. Remind yourself that you're strong and capable and your body was built for this and there's nothing to be afraid of. You can do it.
I was a big 10lb 7oz n my mom had me normal it should be fine
Well when I picked her as my dr I heard reviews on her and everyone had wonderful things to say about her and I just met her when I found out about the GD and she was so mean.
Well I check my sugar 4 times a day and it'd never high so I don't know if I full believe I have gestational diabetes.
Its hard to say with diabeties it all depends on how well controlled you are as im insulin control ino il probably be induced or c section:( good luck
I dont have to take anything for mine just check my levels 4 times a day.
I had gestational diabetes with both my girls they didnt come out big. My first was 5 lbs 9 oz my second 6 lbs 9 oz.
Did anyone get ripped cause of their babies being big?
Why are u scared of a c section?? It really isnt that bad
Cause I want to do it naturally.  And i just really dont want one. I have heard horror stories about them.

question: Everyone keeps telling me I am going to have a big baby but I want to do it natural. At what weight will they say I cant push and do a c-section?
title: how big?
